TWD¶

extremals.TWD(values, means, unstds)[source]¶

Total Weighted Distance

Parameters:values, means, unstds (list) – lists of numbers of the same length
Returns:a number.

It returns the sum of

abs(xt.RWD(values[i],means[i],unstds[i]))

where the sum runs over the indexes i for which values[i] is not NaN.

This function is used when keys = [k_1, ..., k_l] are columns of a dataframe data and x is an index of data, by setting

values[i]  = data[k_i].loc[x]
means[i]   = data[k_i].mean()
un_stds[i] = the un-normalized standard deviation of data[k_i]

In this case:

TWD(values, means, un_stds) = abs(xt.Normalize(data[keys])).sum().loc[x]

The contribution abs(xt.RWD(values[i],means[i],un_stds[i])) measures the distance of data[k_i].loc[x] from the mean of data[k_i]. Thus the higher the value of the sum, the farther are the values values[i] from the mean of the corresponding column. Moreover those contribution are uniform among the various columns as we are using the normalization process described in Normalize.
